conversations.value: Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this! Can you believe people are snowboarding in the middle of the city? I mean, there's literally a house right there!
Wow, yeah, it's like Mother Nature went all out and decided, "You know what the city needs? A big frosty slide!"
I know, right? I'm getting chilly just looking at it. Hey, remember that time I tried snowboarding on our ski trip, and I ended up gliding right into a snowman?
Oh my eyes! My eyes! That was the best. You were like a snow-seeking missile. The snowman never stood a chance.
Oh stop, it wasn't that bad! And look at this person, they’re just in the air, showing off. You think I could've done that if I hadn't crashed into Frosty?
Rachel, you know I love you, but you fall off your heels walking on carpet. But sure, in an alternate universe where you're Regina Phalange, the professional snowboarder, you nailed it!
Very funny, Pheebs. Although, you know what, maybe I will take up snowboarding again. It could be fun!
Yeah, and I'll compose a song for your epic return to the slopes. "Rachel Green, Queen of the Snow, Watch Her Go, Down She'll Go..."
Okay, okay, enough about the falling. We'll make sure to get you some nice ear muffs, so you can’t hear me when I'm screaming down the hill.
As long as I get to wear a cat-themed pair, I’m in. You know, for smelly cat inspiration!
Deal. But seriously, this picture is amazing. The things people come up with, turning a city into a winter wonderland. You think we could do something like that in the Park?
Absolutely! And we could have a Central Perk booth with hot cocoa and my cookies. Could we throw in a guitar-shaped ice sculpture, or is that pushing it?

It’s a Phoebe Buffay event; a guitar ice sculpture is almost expected. Okay, let’s do it. It would be like our own little winter festival. We could even invite Ross, he can give everyone paleontology facts about snow.
Ha! Yes, "Come for the snowboarding, stay for the unsolicited science facts." It'll be the hit of the season!
Definitely not a 'pla' anymore, we've got this all planned out! Now we just need to pitch it to the gang. What should we call it?
How about 'Central Perk's Snowy Spectacular'? With special performances by yours truly, Regina Phalange, and Ken Adams!
You know Joey's going to love that. All right, Central Perk's Snowy Spectacular, it is. Let's make it happen!
They don't know that we know they know we know... how cool this is going to be. Let's shake on it before my other personalities object.
Whoa! Phoebe, check this out! It's like an art show but in a bathroom. What do you think some of these people had for lunch to inspire this kind of creativity?
Oh wow, Joey, this is like the perfect expression of the human soul, trapped in the confines of daily routine, just screaming to break free through a rainbow of graffiti.
Yeah, I guess. It kinda makes you not want to touch anything though, right? Like, I wouldn't even risk the five-second rule in here.
Definitely, though for me it's more like a two-second rule. But you know, Joey, there's something beautiful about the chaos. It's like collective artwork; everyone adding a bit of their own story.
You think we should add something? Maybe "Joey doesn't share food!", so people know, even if they find a piece of pizza on the floor, it's mine.
Ha! I love it! And I could write a note about kindness to animals or something, remind people not to flush their pet fish.
Hey, Phoebs, is it me, or does that smiley face in the corner kinda look like Ross when he says "hi" to a girl he likes?
Oh my God, yes! And you see that little doodle there? Doesn't that just scream 'Regina Phalange' to you?
Totally! Hey, Phoebs, you remember the time I told a girl I was a neurosurgeon to impress her and she believed me? I kinda wanna sign Dr. Drake Ramoray's name here.
Just make sure you don't put down your real phone number, Dr. Casanova. We don't want you getting calls for brain surgery at 3 A.M.
Jokes on them; the only thing I operate on at 3 A.M. is a meatball sub. But seriously, Phoebs, isn't it kinda amazing how stuff like this is like, I dunno, the voice of the people or something?
It's poetry, Joey! An anarchic, unsanitized, sorta stinky type of poetry, but poetry nonetheless. And now we're part of the story.
Yeah, like when you leave footprints on a beach. But instead, it's handprints on a bathroom wall. Hey, I think I'm gettin' the hang of this artsy talk!
You're a natural, Joey. Maybe next time, try not to equate beautiful beach footprints with germy bathroom handprints, though.
So, check out these guys. Could they BE any more into their video game? It's like they've discovered thumb opposability for the first time.
I know! They're totally absorbed by the electronic mind control. This is exactly how the robots will start the uprising. By making humans obsessed with little white remotes.
You know, if Joey were here, he would definitely be the guy giving a thumbs-up, while totally not understanding the game rules.
Absolutely! And then he'd try to feed the remote some of his sandwich, wondering why it's not eating.
And, is it just me, or is the chandelier trying to be the fifth Beatle? I mean, ‘I Am the Walrus’ shouldn't be a theme song for lighting fixtures.
It's probably trying to communicate with them. Like, "Hey, I’m hanging out too, guys! Shine on, you crazy diamond!"
It also looks like someone just told the funniest joke but forgot to invite me to the laugh fest. I'm a funny guy, you know. I tell jokes; I could have spiced things up with a sarcastic comment.
Chandler. If sarcasm is an instrument, you are the entire orchestra. But look at them, living their best lives. It's adorable... in a grown men acting like kids sort of way.
'Living their best lives?' Pheebs, you sound like you're quoting from one of those self-help books that Ross pretends not to read.
No way, I don't need a book to tell people how to be. Unless it's written by a certain Regina Phalange.
Of course, the world-renowned Regina Phalange. Now, if we had a video game about her life, I'd play it. Can you imagine the cheat codes for that?
Well, I heard from Ken Adams that the cheat code is just singing 'Smelly Cat' three times fast.

Note to self: Never play video games with Phoebe unless you want an impromptu concert. Now, shall we go and see if these guys will let us join in? I promise not to Chandler up the place with my competitiveness.
Sure, but we have to call dibs on the sparkly remote. It has cosmic powers, I can feel it. Plus, it'll go great with my aura today.
So, is it just me, or does that clock kind of remind you of the HAL 9000? You know, from the movie where the computer turns evil and starts killing everyone?
Totally! It has that sinister "I'm watching you" vibe. But you know, it's just missing that creepy red eye.
Which is a relief, because the last thing I need is my alarm clock silently judging me for my life choices. Like, 'I'm sorry, Dave, I'm afraid I can't let you hit snooze again.'
It's always "Dave" with those evil computers, huh? They never go after someone named "Bob" or "Regina Phalange."
Yeah, I guess if you want to stay off a sentient computer's radar, just have a less common name. Note to self: consider naming my firstborn "Optimus Prime Bing."
Or you could just avoid technology altogether, live off the grid, and make friends with the woodland creatures. That's Plan B for me.
Plan B? What's Plan A, getting adopted by a millionaire who's into puppetry and abstract finger painting?
No, that was last week's plan. This week, I'm all about cosmic energy. And cosmic energy recommends being friends with time, hence, befriending evil clocks.
Well, if that clock could harness cosmic energy, do you think it would it power down every time Mercury is in retrograde?
Absolutely. And it would only wake you up at the most spiritually optimal time of the day, probably right when you're in the middle of the best dream.
Could that BE any more inconvenient? But hey, at least then we'd all be in sync with the universe, even if that means dreaming about being a giant sandwich chased by a pack of hungry Rosses.
Oh my gosh, Pheebs, look at this pitcher's form. Doesn't he look like that one guy Monica dated who was obsessed with cleaning his fruit?
Totally! That's the kind of energy he probably brought to washing his grapes. Imagine if he used that wrist flick to scrub apples, they'd be, like, the cleanest fruit in the tri-state area.
And look at his focus! I swear, if Mark had been that focused on our projects instead of, you know, me, we might have actually gotten somewhere at Bloomingdale's.
Yeah, well, maybe if his pitches are as good as his picking-up-on-non-verbal-cues skills, he could be, like, the next big baseball star!
Do you think that's a good technique, though? I mean, if he were throwing a wedding bouquet, that bride's going to end up with some combat-level throwing skills.
You know, if I ever get married again, I'm totally going to do that. Just... whoosh! Right into the crowd. Watch out, Granny!
Phoebe, you're already married to Mike.
Oh yeah... Well, renewal of vows then. And this time, I want a pitcher as a maid of honor to really get that bouquet out there.
I'd love to see that. Any chance you'd consider wearing a baseball cap with the dress? It could be a new trend.
Only if I can throw in a catcher's mitt as well. Imagine the photos, Rach. It’s like the perfect blend of elegance and, I don't know, sporty spice.
Look at this, Phoebe! That's Mount Fuji, isn't it? It's a stratovolcano, you know, over 12,000 feet high. It's actually considered an active volcano, though it last erupted in 1707.

Wow, Ross, you really know your stuff! To me, it's just this magical, majestic mountain, poking through the clouds like it's saying hello to the sky. Do you think it has its own spirit, like a mountain guardian or something?
Haha, well, the scientific community doesn't recognize mountain spirits. But I will say, there's a certain... energy you get from looking at geological formations like this one.
I can feel it, even from the photo. It's like Mother Earth is breathing and that's her exhale. It's so peaceful, like nature's meditation.
I've actually always wanted to go to Japan. You know, it's fascinating from a paleontological standpoint. Plus, the country's culture is incredibly rich and beautiful.
You should totally go, Ross. Oh! And you could pick up some healing crystals while you're there. Japanese healing crystals are supposed to be super powerful, you know?
"Healing crystals," right... Well, I might not be getting any crystals, but I wouldn't mind trying to find some fossils. Or maybe even just climb Mount Fuji, if I’m feeling adventurous.
If you climb it, say hello to the mountain spirit for me! Maybe sing it a song. How about "Smelly Cat?" It might enjoy that.
Yeah, maybe not "Smelly Cat," but I'll definitely think of you if I make it up there. This photo really makes me want to book a flight.
And if you fly over it, try not to wake up any dormant volcanoes. We don't need Ross Geller causing an eruption heard around the world.
Phoebe, my track record with marriages is one thing, but I assure you, volcanoes are safe from me.
Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this hotel room! Doesn't it just scream 'mediocre'?
Yeah, it’s like “Hello, I’m a room, and I’m going to try really hard, but you’ll forget me tomorrow.” You know, it has a certain, um... forgettable charm.
I know, right? And what’s with that art above the bed? It's like my mother always says, "just because it fits the frame doesn't mean it belongs on the wall."

Totally. It's probably one of those mass-produced pieces that's supposed to be calming. But I think it has the spirit of a tortured artist trapped inside. Every time you look at it, it slowly eats away at your soul.
You're so weird, Pheebs. And I bet the bed feels like a rock. Remember that one time at the Marriott?
How could I forget? Your back was so stiff the next day you walked like a robot. It was hilarious. But this bed could be a soft cloud, a place where dreams come to take a little nap.
I guess there's only one way to find out. But wait, do you see that chair over there? It seems... lonely.

It does! It’s like, “Please, spend time with me. I can be fun too.” It's trying to sell itself, like "Sit on me, and life's mysteries will unfold before you." Or it could just be a place to throw your coat.
And look at that. There's always a random desk, isn't there? As if I'm going to suddenly write my autobiography on a whim!
Right? Maybe it's there for inspiration. You sit down, and bam, you start penning, "The Rachel Green Story: A Tale of Hair and Heartbreak."
Hey, my life is so much more than just hair and heartbreak!
Of course, I know. It's also about shopping and... shoes. Oh, and love with a dash of dinosaurs.
You're impossible, Pheebs. Okay, let's check out the window view. Maybe we'll be surprised.
Yes! Maybe it’s a view of a magical land filled with flying puppies and rainbows. Or, you know, probably just the parking lot.
Well, here goes nothing...
Oh wow, look at this, Phoebe. Doesn't this picture remind you of the time we had to pivot that couch up the stairs at my place?
Definitely, except there's no shouting 'Pivot! Pivot! Pivot!' which I still hear in my nightmares, by the way.

Ha! Sorry about that, still, the strategy was sound, it was just the walls and physics that were the problem. Anyway, isn't that bedspread kind of... whimsical? It's got that playful character you're so fond of.
Yeah, it's screaming of fun... you know, in a subdued, I'm-a-grown-up kinda way. But hey, what's with that random chair at the foot of the bed? It's like it's lost and looking for a desk.
You're right! It's like the chair is saying, 'I wish I could be part of the bedroom set, but I don’t want to'. Classic Phoebe line, by the way.
You know me – always happy to lend my voice to inanimate objects. And hey, look at the cat! It's like the opposite of Smelly Cat – it's Clean Cat, Clean Cat...
Yes, it's all poised and content. Probably waiting for a human to come in and mess up the bed just so it can enjoy the comfort all over again.
That's so like a cat, right? Regal and demanding. If only it could speak, I bet it would introduce itself as, 'Regina Phalange, Queen of the Bedroom.'
And I would be 'Dr. Ross Eustace Geller, Ph.D., Feline Admirer and Bed-Making Skeptic'.
Ha! I'd love to see that on your business cards! But let's get serious for a moment, Ross. This room, don't you think it's got a somewhat... lonely vibe?
Hmm, I suppose so. It's clean, orderly, quiet... Kind of makes you appreciate the chaos of our group, doesn't it?
Exactly! The beautiful mess of having friends and family around – that's what makes a home. Otherwise, it's just a 'pla' with furniture.
Would you look at this, Phoebe? That's an amazing shot of a giraffe being fed by a visitor. Isn't it remarkable how such a wild animal can exhibit such gentle behavior around humans?
Oh yeah, it's like he knows she's helping him. It's that animal intuition. I bet he can sense her aura is all rainbow-y and sparkly.

Auras aside, it's their biology that's fascinating. Did you know giraffes have a specialized structure in their necks called the nuchal ligament that supports their heavy heads? And they only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep in a 24-hour period!
That little sleep would explain why they're so tall; they have all that extra time to grow! You know, if I didn't sleep for like, three days, maybe I could finally reach the top shelf in my kitchen.

I'm not sure it works that way for humans, Phoebe. Plus, they have a four-chambered stomach and eat up to 75 pounds of leaves a day. If we didn't need sleep and ate that much, I’m pretty sure we wouldn’t be reaching for the top shelf; we’d be expanding horizontally!

Well, Ross, some people grow up, others grow out. Giraffes are just living their best life. I wonder if he has friends, or maybe a special giraffe lady friend. Do you think giraffes date? Like, having a little neck rub, saying, "You make my heart go 'giraffe-a-dub-dub.'"
Actually, giraffe courtship is quite fascinating. Male giraffes will test a female's fertility by tasting her urine. If it's to their liking, they'll court her through a process called "necking."
Urine tasting? Gross! Forget I asked. They should stick to neck rubs as far as I'm concerned.
You know what, Phoebe? That's an image I'm okay with replacing the actual scientific fact. Let's go with the neck rubs idea.
Speaking of which, that lady in the picture looks like she could use a neck rub herself after holding up that bowl. Feeding a giraffe is intense arm workout!
Absolutely. Though I doubt she minds. This kind of interaction with a majestic creature must be quite the experience. It really makes one appreciate the beauty of wildlife.
For sure. You know, if I were her, I'd sing to him. A little "Smelly Cat" rendition for giraffes. "Tall-y Giraffe-y, Tall-y Giraffe-y, what are they feeding you?"
I'm sure that would be the highlight of his day. But hey, if you ever decide to serenade a giraffe, I am so coming with you. I wouldn’t miss that for the world.
It's a date then! Ross and Phoebe, the giraffe whisperers extraordinaires. Let the singing commence!
Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this old photo! These costumes are so classic, don't you think? The man's top hat and the woman's pillbox hat are so retro chic!
Yeah, they totally have that vintage vibe going on. It's like they're on a movie set from the '60s, right where they're about to break into a jolly song about chimney sweeps or something.
Hah, exactly! It's like Mary Poppins meets Oliver Twist. Can you imagine trying to pull off one of those outfits at Central Perk?
I could definitely rock that pillbox hat. And you know, carrying around a giant broom could be my new quirky thing. It could help me sweep away all the bad energy.
Plus, if Gunther gave you a hard time, you'd have the perfect comeback. "I'm just here to clean up the coffee beans with my giant broom."
Absolutely, and I could sing "Smelly Cat" in the style of a mysterious Victorian street performer. Oh, that would be legendary!
You'd become the most fashionable street sweeper in all of New York. We could start a new trend, Phoebe. The Central Perk Cleanup Crew!
Yes! And I could start by sweeping away all the guys who aren't good for you. Starting with… Well, you know who.
Please do. But uh, let's keep the brooms away from my Ralph Lauren collection, okay?
Don't worry, Rachel. Your precious clothes are safe from my whimsical cleaning spree. I'm not Regina Phalange, the Destroyer of Fashion.
Good, because you know I love you, but I'd tackle you to the ground if it meant saving a cashmere sweater.
Oh, I know. But honestly, I bet if you wore one of these glorious retro ensembles, you'd be the trendiest girl in all the land— or at least in the coffee shop.
It's settled then! Tomorrow, you with your broom and me with—do you think I could get away with a corset in broad daylight?
Rachel, with your confidence and my broomstick, we could get away with anything.
So, check out these guys. Could they BE any more into their wine?
I know, right? They're like, "We're not just drinking wine; we're experiencing it."
You have to wonder though, do they have any idea they're actually just a cheap bottle's journey away from a hangover so bad it could be an actual place? You know, like Hangoveristan.
Ha! I bet their spirit animals are like, uh, sophisticated French giraffes. You know, the kind that prefer grapes fermented.
Spirit animals that look down on all the other animals at the watering hole. "We don't drink water, it's so passé."
Exactly! And the giraffes are all quoting Baudelaire while discussing existentialism.
Nothing says, "I'm pondering the futility of existence" like swirling a glass of pinot noir. Oh, how I've missed these talks with you, Pheebs.
Me too! It's like my day just isn't complete without a little touch of Bing sarcasm served with a side of weirdness.
Could that BE any more of a concrete jungle for that poor bear?
Chandler, it's like it's begging us to start a bear-liberation front. Look at its little bear face, it's practically human!
Yeah, if I squint hard enough, it kind of resembles my boss on a Monday morning. Minus the fur...and the claws...and...no, there it is.
It's looking at us like, "Hey, can you help a bear out?" I feel like it wants to write sad, melancholic poetry.
Would the poetry be about a world where the salmon runs free, and the honey is plentiful? Because, sign me up!
Exactly! And it could have a really emotional refrain like, "Where are the trees, the birds, and the bees? Oh woe, oh woe is me."
And in the bear's world, having a "pot to pee in" is actually a good thing. It just means more honey.
I wish I could serenade it with my guitar. Maybe "Smelly Cat" has a cousin, "Solitary Bear?"
Honestly, I think your singing might just cheer him up. Or, you know, scare him into hibernation. Whichever comes first.
Or it could awaken his inner spirit animal, calling him to rise up and break free from his barriers.
Let's hold off on the bear uprising until we at least have an exit strategy. But hey, on the bright side, at least someone's having a worse day than me.
We should do something! Maybe write a strongly worded letter? Or we could get the bear a roommate, you know, like a penguin or a really big cat?
And if we get a penguin, we could start a new show, "Friends: The Wilderness Edition."
Yes! With opening credits featuring the bear and the penguin splashing around in that pool. I can see it now!
I'll be there for you, because you're there for me too – even if "you" is a bear and "me" is just incredibly guilty about my species' environmental policies.
Oh my gosh, Phoebe, look at this pizza! It's massive! Can you believe the size of it?
It's like the universe is challenging me to a duel, and you know what, universe? Challenge accepted! But I don't eat meat, so I shall conquer the vegetarian section!
Right? It's like this pizza is the size of one of my daddy's golf umbrellas. I bet Joey would just fold it and eat it like a taco.
He's so gifted. You know, in an alternate dimension, Joey is probably the supreme ruler of all the pizzas, bending them to his will.
I'm already brainstorming the perfect outfit to eat this. I'm thinking something with an elastic waistband. There's no way I’m fitting into my skinny jeans after a slice... or five.
Honey, just invoke the Joey special: Thanksgiving pants! Fashion and feasting, hand in hand.
That is so smart, Pheebs. Why didn't I think of that? That's what I need for, like, every day at work. I swear, it's like my office celebrates someone's birthday every day with cake.
Yes! And you can call them your "Ralph Lauren Raucous Eating Pants." Make it a trend; I believe in you.
Ha! You are brilliant. But seriously, doesn't this pizza just look delicious? Although, I would definitely pick off the olives. I just can't with olives.
Yes, banish them! Banish them to the land of unwanted toppings where they can think about what they've done.
Thanks, Phoebe. You always get me. How about we grab a slice? First one has to finish it without the help of 'Ralph Lauren Raucous Eating Pants'.
You are on, Green! But let's not forget to pay homage to Italy for blessing us with this circle of joy. Grazie, Italia!
Look at this, Phoebe! Isn't that just the craziest skiing fail you've ever seen? I hope they're okay!
Oh my goddess, it's like they're trying to become one with the snow. Or maybe they're just hugging a tree with their face. Do you think trees need hugs?
I'm all for tree-hugging, but I really hope this person knew how to fall safely. You know, like how I tried to teach Joey to catch a ball without fumbling? Same principle.

Totally. Trees are actually really good at catching humans, they have so many arms. But seriously, safety first! Joey's ball-catching was a journey for all of us. This person's probably having their own journey. To like, Upside-down-land.

Upside-down-land, ha! You know, sometimes I wonder how you come up with these things. You're hilarious, Pheebs. Speaking of journeys, do you think Chandler would ever try skiing? I mean, I'd have to baby-proof the entire mountain!
Chandler on skis... that's a sitcom episode waiting to happen. We'd need all the mountain spirits to keep an eye on him. And maybe some bubble wrap. A lot of bubble wrap.
"Monica clean" wouldn't even begin to cover getting out those ski stains. And can you imagine? "Chandler Bing: The Abominable Snowman," complete with bubble wrap?
Ha! Yes! And then he would just roll down the mountain and turn it into a giant snowball fight. But like, a friendly one where everyone laughs and makes snow angels afterward.

That'd be a sight. But back to the skier — think we should add them to our prayers tonight? I mean, not that I pray... I'm more of a 'take charge' person, but sometimes a little extra help from the universe wouldn't hurt.

Definitely. I'll ask my grandma's spirit to watch over them too. And my shoulder angel Smelly Cat, just to be thorough. Plus, it'll make a fun story for the spirits. They love a good human tumble tale.
You're the best kind of weird, Phoebe. Okay, how about we make some hot cocoa and watch some professional skiing to get the hang of it? You know, visual learning and all that!
Ooh! I'm in! And afterwards, we could write a song about ski safety. Like "Safety First, or You Might Thirst... for a Cast."
Can't wait to hear it. You're the next Snowy Mozart, Phoebe. Let's do it!
Hey, Phoebe, check this out. These motorcycles... you know, they remind me of when I tried to look cool by renting one, but ended up just wobbling around the parking lot for an hour.
Oh my God, Ross, I can totally see you doing that. Flailing and freaking out with your dinosaur arms! Was it during your leather pants phase? Because that's just the cherry on top.

No, this was way before the leather pants debacle. Speaking of animals though, isn't it kind of sad how these bikes might scare away pigeons or something? What are your thoughts on the noise pollution aspect, from your animal-loving perspective?

Absolutely, Ross. You know, animals have super sensitive ears! My Smelly Cat probably would have written a whole verse about the rumble of those engines. Plus, the vibrations disrupt their little navigational senses. It's like, "Excuse me, Mr. Biker, but could you not?"

And from a scientific point of view, the impact on urban wildlife is actually quite substantial. The whole ecosystem can get thrown off. But let's pivot away from the negatives for a second. You can't deny there's something inherently freeing about riding on the open road, wind in your hair...
Oh sure, I mean if I were riding one of those, I'd be Regina Phalange, the wind-whispering biker queen of the... say, where do you think they're headed, Ross?
Well, if I had to guess based on the direction they're headed, I'd say they're going towards the more industrial part of town—maybe to a motorcycle club or some sort of gathering?

Ooh, a gathering of like-minded, leather-clad, helmet-wearing road warriors sharing stories of their travels. You know, the universe could be pushing them together for a reason—they might be a band of motorcycle angels!

Motorcycle angels, huh? Yeah, I suppose in a Phoebe-logical sense, that would be their celestial motif. I have to admit, despite their tough exterior, bikers do have a sense of camaraderie and a code of honor. It's actually quite fascinating, sociologically speaking.
Exactly, Ross! Like the biker code, they have secret handshakes and nod rituals – Oh! They're like modern-day knights, with their steeds of steel and shiny round table helmets!

Well, when you put it that way, it does paint a rather romantic picture. Though I can assure you, historically, knights were a bit less... revvy. But speaking of history, would you believe me if I told you the whole motorcycle culture stemmed from post-war improvements in motorcycle technology?

That's the least surprising thing you've said all day. Ross, you always manage to make things a delightful blend of geeky and adorable. But seriously, I would love to see you on a bike again, just to watch you try and 'pivot' through the traffic.
Wow, check out this guy! He's dressed like he's popped out of a different era!
Oh yeah, he's totally channeling the spirit of a Victorian gentleman. It's like he's waiting to give Charles Dickens a high-five.
It's strange though, everything about his outfit screams attention to detail, but then the environment—it's all worn down and in stark contrast to his, uh, meticulously picked attire.
Maybe that's his thing, you know? Like, embracing the dichotomy between the inner self and the external chaos. It's very deep.
Dichotomy? Phoebe, I think you might be reading a little too much into this. I mean, could be he's just at a costume party, or maybe he's an actor on a break.
Or maybe he's a time traveler, and that's his time machine behind him! It's like, way less obvious than a DeLorean.
Time travel? Come on, Phoebe. You don't actually believe in that stuff, do you?
Believe it? Ross, I've practically done it. There's this meditation I do where I can see into past lives. Last week, I was a nurse in World War I. True story.
Your past lives. Right. How could I forget? Anyway, you know, as a scientist, I can tell you, the concept of time travel goes against all known laws of physics.
Yeah, well, your 'known laws of physics' also say that bumblebees shouldn't be able to fly. But they do, Ross. They fly.
That's actually a common misconception. You see, the physics of bee flight are just not well understood by laypeople—
Ross, Ross, don't ruin this with science. Let's just enjoy the mystery of the man who could be bounding across time and space.
Fine, fine. We'll "enjoy the mystery." But if he starts talking about investing in Apple stocks in the '80s or buying bitcoin in 2009, I'm teaching him a thing or two about the space-time continuum.

So I was trying to think of the most likely scenario in which I become a cat, and this image has got to be it. Staring at my reflection all day, contemplating the choices I've made, like allowing Joey to eat my last donut.
I totally get this. This kitty is clearly having a deep spiritual moment. Like, maybe it's realizing its past life as a pharaoh. Cats were royalty in ancient Egypt, you know.
Royalty, huh? That's quite the step down to modern-day shower dwellers. I wonder if it knows it's just lost its throne for a... spot on a bath mat.
No, no. He's probably thinking, 'Look at that stunning creature in the mirror. Such poise, such grace. Oh, wait, it's me!'
Could it BE any more narcissistic? But if I were that handsome, I'd probably stare all day too. I mean, not that I do. Stare all day, at myself. In the mirror. Moving on.
What if he's not just looking at his reflection, but he's actually communicating with the Mirror Cat Universe? It's like, 'Hey, mirror me, got any advice on how to catch those red laser dots?'
Seeking wisdom from alternate dimensions. Makes sense. Meanwhile, I'm still trying to seek approval from my office's break room vending machine.
Well, if he starts pawing at the mirror, play him "Smelly Cat". It's a surefire way to break the ice with interdimensional beings.
Great, because what this cat clearly needs is a soundtrack for its existential crisis. And if "Smelly Cat" doesn't work, I can always perform my shower rendition of "We Are the Champions."
You sing in the shower? Chandler, that is so cute! This is exactly why you resonated with this cat—soulful eyes full of artistic expression. And a love for good acoustics.
Can we keep that between us? And 'soulful eyes'? Are we still talking about the cat, or have we moved on to judging my best puppy-dog look?
Oh my God, Phoebe, look at those desserts! I swear, if I didn't have to work in fashion, where you literally have to be a mannequin, I would eat every single one of those.
I know, right? They're like little frosted pillows of joy. And you know, mannequins never get the joy of tasting. I bet they're all secretly sad on the inside.
I bet they are, Pheebs. Remember when Joey "The Health Nut" Tribbiani ate an entire cheesecake that was meant to be shared? I'm getting that same impulse right now.
Joey and his cheesecake crimes! You know what, if you indulge and someone sees, just say it's for a new trend called "eating happiness." And I'll back you up with my psychic nutritionist endorsement!
"Eating happiness," I love that! But seriously, don't you think the pink frosted one looks so cute? It's giving me inspiration for a new line of summer dresses.
Absolutely! Adorable; like if a unicorn decided to go into fashion. And hey, if you make that dress, you could totally wear the donut too; it's called accessorizing.
Phoebe, you're a genius! Dresses that match your dessert, why didn't I think of that? It’s... charming and quirky, kind of like you.
Well, you know, I'm full of ideas. Some say it's my sixth sense. Others, well, they mostly just say, "Phoebe, maybe just play the song." But this idea's a keeper!
You know what, let’s do it. Let’s try these divine-looking treats and call it market research. Tomorrow, I am going to pitch the sweetest summer collection ever.
Yes! Your pitches will be the talk of the fashion world. "Dresses good enough to eat by Rachel Green." They'll eat it up; pun totally intended.
With you as my muse, we’re gonna shake up the whole industry! Thank you, Phoebe. And, you know, you could totally walk down the runway with a guitar, singing 'Smelly Cat'.

Now that would be a show. It will be fashion, music, and possibly some environmental activism all rolled into one. Oh! And you could have a "no more using donuts as bracelets" policy – it's cruel and delicious.
Agreed! No donut deserves being worn as a bracelet. They deserve better. They deserve to be eaten.
And loved. And perhaps sung to. I'm going to write a song about this. "Ode to the Lonely Donut," it'll be a tearjerker.
Look at this, Phoebe! Isn't this just the prettiest flower arrangement? This would look amazing in the apartment, don't you think?
Yeah, it's like Mother Nature just threw a party and those flowers are the confetti. You know, if Mother Nature were real and not just a metaphor. But still, yay, confetti!
Ha, right? And the vase is so stylish too. It's just so... Me. Do you know what I mean?
Totally. If you were a vase, this is what you would look like. Except, you know, with arms and legs... and a head... and maybe a little Ralph Lauren logo somewhere.

I could totally see that vase in one of the Ralph Lauren showrooms, actually. And those flowers, they kind of remind me of the bouquet Ross sent me once. Just, you know, without all the awkward 'we were on a break' baggage.
Flowers are so much better when they don't come with emotional turmoil. Like these little guys, they're just here to spread joy and make the room smell good.
Exactly! Speaking of smelling good, doesn't this remind you of something?
You mean... Natural scents, not tested on animals, no ozone layer depletion? Wait, are you suggesting we turn them into a cologne?
Maybe not a cologne, Pheebs, but like a nice room fragrance or something. Sort of a 'welcome home, relax, you're in a beautiful place' vibe.
That's a lovely idea! We could call it... "Serene Blossoms" or "Tranquil Petals." I could even write a jingle for it!
You totally should! Maybe just... don't make it about smelly cats this time?
Deal. But only if you promise that if this becomes a real thing, you'll use your fashion connections to get us on the shelves. It's like, flowers meet fashion, you know?
You've got yourself a deal, Phoebe Buffay. "Flowers meet fashion" could be huge! But can we agree, no 'Regina Phalange' on the branding?
Of course, unless we open a store in France; then it's non-negotiable. "Regina Phalange's Tranquil Petals" has a nice ring to it, n'est-ce pas?
Let's stick to one continent at a time, Pheebs. But I love the enthusiasm!
Look at that, Phoebe. Could that BE any more of a comforting meal?
Oh my God, Chandler, it's like a hug in a bowl paired with a love sandwich.
You know, if my mom had served this at Thanksgiving, I might actually have fond memories of the holiday.
Yeah, nothing says family bonding like a bowl of tomato soup and the joy of not chewing lettuce.
Speaking of joy and not chewing, if Joey was here, he'd inhale that meal faster than Janice's laugh pierces my soul.
Chandler, you're so funny! I think Joey would just absorb the food telepathically. Who needs to chew when you have a superpower, right?
Ha, you think Joey's superpower is eating? I thought it was somehow avoiding paying for anything ever.
Well, that and being able to smell a sandwich from three apartment blocks away. So basically, his superpowers revolve around sandwiches.
Phoebe, you're such a Mozart with words. If this meal were a song, what would be the title?
Totally easy. It would be, "Tomato Soup Serenade with Cheesy Rhapsody on Rye". What about you?
I'd call it, "The Ballad of the Lonely Lettuce Leaf", because look at it all alone on that plate. Can't help but feel it's singing, "All By Myself".
You know, Chandler, sometimes I worry about you. But then, food analyzing is definitely a step up from your traditional fear of commitment.
Hey, I've come a long way! I'm fully committed... to finishing this meal.
Well said! Let's dig in before the sandwich becomes a philosophical statement about transience.
And before the soup gains sentience and starts asking us existential questions.
Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this! Don't you think this is, like, the perfect spot for a fashion shoot? It's so urban and chic!
Yeah, it's like the city is wearing its own couture. But instead of fabric, it's using... spray paint. And instead of models, it's got that... very serious-looking payphone.

I know, right? The colors are just popping! I could totally see someone rocking a leather jacket and some cool boots here. But that payphone reminds me of a relic from the past. Who uses payphones anymore?

That payphone is probably feeling pretty lonely. If it were a song, it'd be 'Smelly Cat's' less popular cousin, 'Neglected Phone'. And I agree with the fashion bit, it screams distressed denim and statement pieces. Someone call Vogue!

Vogue! Yes! And you could totally compose a hit song here, Pheebs. Something about the colors of the soul or the rhythms of the street. You'd be unforgettable; you and your guitar right here could be iconic.
"The Colors of the Soul," that's not bad! And look, there's even green in the graffiti, it's cosmic! The universe supports your idea.
Haha, Pheebs, I'll take that as a compliment! The universe and fashion, now that's a combination I didn't expect to think about today.
Speaking of fashion, wouldn't it be amazing if clothes could change colors like chameleons? Like, you're standing in front of this wall and your dress just blends in! You'd become one with the art!
Oh my God, Phoebe, that would be incredible! Transformative fashion, like, literally transformative. Could be the next big thing. Imagine having that in my line... or presented at Ralph Lauren!

There you go, you’ve got this! And really, you should pitch that idea. You could change fashion forever! And the payphone could be the symbol of the old world watching as we all transform. Like a silent guardian of history.

Wow, Pheebs, that's kind of deep. I love it! A tribute to what once was as we move into the future. Perfect mix of nostalgia and progress. But, you have to promise me that when my transformative fashion line takes off, you'll be my first live installation artist.
Rachel, it's like you can see right into my aura. I promise, I'll be there—I'll even write a special tune for the occasion. Something like "Mystical Threads of Time"... or is that too much?
No, it's perfect, just like this graffiti wall we stumbled upon. It's kismet, Phoebe. You, me, the wall, and the lonely payphone—all part of one fabulous New York moment.
Yes! Kismet with a side of destiny. And I bet even the payphone feels less lonely now. We've shared its story with the universe.
A story for the ages, Pheebs. Now let's go find some coffee, I feel like all this creativity has earned us a break!
I'm in. Maybe the barista can predict our future in the foam... I feel like today it'll be extra frothy with a hint of greatness!
Whoa, look at these guys go, Pheebs! They're movin' faster than I run to the fridge at a commercial break!
I know, it's like they're almost flying, but with wheels. It's like... wheelie flying!
Ha! That's a good one, Pheebs. Wheelie flying, I gotta remember that. Hey, if I was on that bike, I bet I could even outrun Chandler's sarcastic remarks.
Joey, with the way you eat? I think the only thing you'd be outrunning is the expiration date on a meatball sub.
Hey, I'm in good shape! Remember when I did all those push-ups for the firemen TV show audition?
Yes, and I also remember you couldn't lift your arms for a week after.
That's 'cause I did like a million of them! Okay, not a million, but enough to impress that director... until he told me to act, and then, uh, not so much.
Hey, acting on those bikes would be pretty tough, though. Imagine having to remember your lines while zooming around like that!
Oh man, I'd probably just yell, "How you doin'?" every time I passed another racer. Keep it simple, you know?
And I could see you trying to eat a sandwich while riding, causing a Joey-style crash.
Phoebe! Joey doesn't share food, and Joey definitely doesn't eat and drive. That's dangerous. Also, imagine dropping a perfectly good sandwich. The horror!
True, that would be a travesty. Let's leave the fast driving to the pros, and stick with fast eating, for you at least.
Now that's a race I know I can win. Hey, wanna go grab a pizza and watch these guys on TV? I bet it's even cooler with sound effects!
Yes, and I can play my latest song during commercials. It's called "Fast Cats and the Furry Road." Inspired by "Smelly Cat," of course, but with more adrenaline.
You're on, Pheebs. But I ain't missing any of this race, not even for "Smelly Cat."
Alright, so if that baby zebra asks where stripes come from, is the mom going to say "Well, when a mommy zebra and a daddy zebra love each other very much, they go to the 'stripe store'?"
No, Chandler, she's going to sing "Stripy Cat, Stripy Cat, it's clearly your dad you take after."
If that's the case, there's a future in children's music for zebras and I'm clearly missing out. Could I BE any more out of the loop?
You know, they should, and you could play the triangle! It's very inclusive in the animal kingdom band. Plus, I bet mommy zebra could tell some wild stories about their stripey adventures.

That's right because in the wild, a trip to the watering hole is like spring break for these guys. But do you think the zebra dad also takes him to the barber and says, "Just a little off the sides, don't touch the stripes"?
Absolutely. They have to stay fashionable. It's nature's way of saying, 'Look at me, I'm a fabulous zebra with amazing hair.'
I can see it now: "Zebra: The Mane Event." Could that BE any more of a hit TV show?
I'd watch it. And you could write the jokes, Chandler. But only if they're not too "hairy"!
As long as they include my comedic "tails." Get it? Because zebras have... tails.
You're lucky I like puns, Bing-a-ling. Because if I didn't, I might have to feed you to the lions!
And there goes my survival instinct, telling me it's time to run faster than a zebra at an 'avoid becoming lion lunch' marathon.
Phoebe, check this out! This image, doesn't it just... speak volumes about the historical evolution of urban environments? I mean, consider the architectural style and the cars—vintage!
Oh wow, yeah. It's like a window to a whole other time. It's kind of like the spirits from the past are reaching out to us, haunting these streets with their old-timey vibes.
Haunting? Uh, well, I was thinking more along the lines of a physical representation of the era's socio-economic status and technological advancement, but sure, haunting works too.
Absolutely, Ross. It's eerie and beautiful. And look at the light and shadows—so dramatic! It's as if there's a secret message hidden in the picture, you know?
Secret message? Well, if you mean the urban planning methods of the mid-20th century and how light plays a significant role in creating a living space, then yes, I totally see it.

Ross, you're such a science guy. Always so literal! I'm talking about the metaphysical messages that photos can carry. But, let’s put a pin on that. Look at the car by the street—isn't it just begging for a cool backstory?
Absolutely. That's a classic automobile! Knowing the make and model could help us pinpoint the exact year this photo was taken. Could be a real clue to the historical context of the...
Or it could've been a getaway car for a bank heist! Ooh, or maybe it belonged to a secret government agent. The possibilities are endless!
You have quite the imagination, Phoebe. You know what, though? That's what's great about historical images. They invite us to explore the facts and the fictions of the times!
They do, don't they? And, hey, did you notice the lady crossing the street? I bet she's got some tales to tell.
Possibly about the socio-political climate and how it influenced pedestrian traffic patterns. Or... I suppose, in your world, she might be a time traveler!
Ross, that's exactly what I'm thinking! She’s on a mission. She has that stride, like she knows where she's going—which is more than I can say for most people.
You know what, Phoebe? Let's find stories in this image, the way you see it. It could be a fun exercise for my analytical brain.
Now we're talking! Magic is all around us, even in old photos. Let our imaginations run wild!
Right! Who needs a paleontological dig when you have the majestic landscape of Phoebe's mind?
Exactly, Ross! Welcome to the land of Phoebe; I hope you enjoy your stay!
Trust me, it's already a unique experience.
Look at this, Pheebs! Have you ever seen so many kitesurfers at once?
Wow, it's like a flock of colorful birds decided to take a swim class. So whimsical!
I know! It's amazing, and the way they're all synchronized, it makes me think of a dance on water.
Or, like, an oceanic ballet with an invisible conductor. Hey, maybe it's Poseidon's work!
Haha, only you would think of Poseidon. But seriously, don't you think it would be so much fun to try this?
Totally! Although, I'd probably end up talking to the fish more than kitesurfing.
Of course you would. I bet the fish would love your rendition of "Smelly Cat."
They might! As long as it doesn’t offend the kitesurfing birds—I mean people.
Could you imagine if we got the whole gang to do it? Chandler on a kitesurf, now that's something I need to see.
Oh yes! And I can hear Joey now, "How you doin'?" to every single wave.
And Ross would just be spouting facts about the wind currents and the physics of kitesurfing.
And little harmonica-bikini Ursula would somehow already be there, stealing tips from tourists.
Pheebs, only you could make me laugh about Ursula. Let's do this, let's book a kitesurfing lesson!
As long as we're not on the ocean during a full moon. Don't want to upset the sea witches.
Right, the sea witches. How could I forget? Alright, let's find a "sea witch-free" day and do it. It’ll be Monica clean fun. Seven! Seven! Seven levels of fun!
I'll start braiding my hair and practicing my "kite-surfer lingo." Cowabunga, dude!
Ugh, Pheebs, cowabunga is for surfers, not kitesurfers! But you know what, never mind, let's just go with it. It's gonna be awesome!

Hey Phoebe, come check this out! This is one of those action shots taken in bursts to show motion. I bet as a paleontologist, I could learn a thing or two about movement analysis from this. You see, it's all about the biomechanics.

Ross, that's great and all, but you do know that's tennis, right? Not, like, dinosaur tennis. Although, that would be the coolest thing ever! Could you imagine a T-Rex trying to swing a racket with those tiny arms?

Yeah, that would quite literally be prehistoric power tennis! But, you know, a bipedal posture would actually be a disadvantage in a game based on agility and... Anyway, what do you see when you look at this image?

Hmm, I see the human body expressing itself through sport. It's like a form of modern dance but with more grunting and less tutus. And you know, if I listen really closely, I can hear her competitive spirit... It's saying, 'I will crush you, but I’ll be super graceful about it.'
You always have such a unique perspective, Pheebs. She does look like she's fiercely determined to win. Athletic competition seems to bring that out in people.
Totally. It's like when I play my music, you know? Each chord resonates with the vibrations of my soul. When she hits that ball, she's probably doing the same, except with, you know, a tennis ball.

I've never thought of sports that way, kind of like a physical expression of the soul. It's a poetic thought. You know, sports and music both have a rhythm and flow to them, a sort of dance with physics. It's fascinating when you think about it.
Yes, Ross! You're getting it! And just think – every time she hits the ball, it's like she's sending out a little wave of energy into the universe, like a stone skipping across the cosmic pond.
Wow, Phoebe, I never thought I'd say this, but I think you just made tennis sound transcendental to me. It's like each serve and volley is part of a greater cosmic... game.
Look at all those people out there, it's like one of my catering gigs, but with more... sweat. And is that Central Park West?
Yeah, it's definitely not the Serengeti, although with all those runners, it kind of looks like a wildebeest migration.
Right? It’s like a Monica-clean level of organization with all those lanes. I wonder if they're competitive. You know, if I was out there, I’d totally be leading the pack.

Mon, I’m sure you would—with your elbows out and that scary determined face. But you know, I think it's not all about being first. It's about the spirit of it, people coming together, running their little hearts out. Like wind goddesses and stuff.

Haha, Phoebs, you and your wind goddesses. But you have a point; there's something kind of beautiful about it all, isn't there? Though those water stations would have a much better layout if I was in charge.
Totally, you'd have the water cups arranged by color and size. Oh, and a station for energy bars shaped like tiny little shoes. Because, you know, you're a shoe... or was it a hat?
Definitely a hat, Phoebe. But those energy bars are not a bad idea. I mean, I could make them Monica-style, not only nutritious but delicious!

I know! And you could do something crazy like, infuse them with humor. Imagine, eating a bar that makes you laugh. That's the kind of energy you need for running. Or you know, fleeing from scary ghosts.
Ghosts? What, do you think there’s a ghost marathon in the afterlife? "Boo! To the finish line!"
Why not? If there is, I bet they pass right through the water stations. Haha, get it? Because they're ghosts...
You're incorrigible, Phoebs. But okay, if you were running this marathon, what would push you to the finish line? Like, what's your ultimate motivator?

Hm, if I were running from something, probably the usual: clowns, or an ex-boyfriend reincarnated as a pigeon. But running towards something? Probably a pet store with rescue kittens at the finish line.
That's so you. As for me, it’s the thought of that medal at the end. You know how I love to win. But also, a big fat cheesecake waiting just for me. Not shared, Phoebs, all mine!

Of course, your competitive nature even extends to dessert. And I'd help you make room for that cheesecake - by eating it! Because my eyes, my eyes, Monica, they've seen that cheesecake and now they can't unsee it.
Deal, but you're helping me make them next time. And we'll make a special batch called "Phoebe's Funny Bars."
Yes! With little musical notes on them. And each bite gives you a different note, so when you eat, you make a song!
A song and a dessert? Phoebe, that’s actually genius! We'll table that idea for my next event. Now, let’s make a sign for those runners. What do you say?
Absolutely! Let's write something motivational like, "Run like there's a Hot Guy in front of you and a Creepy Guy behind you!"
That's brand new information, Phoebs! You crack me up. Alright, sign-making it is. Let’s do this!
Would you look at that? Just when you thought traffic signals couldn't get any more confusing, they give you... this. Could they add any more lights and signs?
It's not that confusing, Ross. It's like the universe giving you a big red-and-yellow stop-and-go hug. Plus, no left turns – it's very straightforward.
A hug? Pheebs, the only thing that's going to embrace me is frustration. I mean, how would one navigate this if, let's say, they're in a rush?
Simple. This is where you let go and let the universe take the wheel. You know, metaphorically speaking. Besides, wouldn't hurt to slow down and enjoy the scenery.
Right, because the universe has a driver's license. You know, in traffic engineering, there's a thing about optimizing flow and reducing congestion, and this... this is the opposite of that.
Maybe it's less about the flow of cars and more about the flow of energy, you know? Like, if you're not meant to turn left, then maybe it's just not your path.
Okay, but speaking from a scientific perspective, sometimes you need to turn left. There's a destination and the most efficient route would be—

Ross, not everything is about efficiency. Sometimes it's about the journey. This traffic signal could be like a metaphorical crossroads in life. You can't always get what you want the way you want it.
Well, that's certainly true. I mean, if life were a series of traffic lights, mine would be stuck on yellow – proceed with caution due to, uh, past... turbulence.
But don't forget, yellow also means that something great is just about to happen. Like the light is about to turn green, or maybe you'll find out that they didn't actually steal your sandwich!

You have an answer for everything, don't you, Phoebe? But okay, if that traffic signal represents life's crossroads, then I say we trust the journey... But I'm still not sold on the universal driving license idea.

And that's okay, Ross. You just keep on being your adorably logical paleontologist self. Just know that when it's time to turn left, the universe—and me, Phoebe Buffay—will be here to guide you. No traffic signs needed.
Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this picture. Can you believe the congestion? Makes me glad we're not in the middle of that, huh?
Totally. It's like the traffic is flowing like molasses in winter. Do you think they have winters in Bangkok? I should write a song about tropical winters!
Ha! You do that, Pheebs. But you know what's odd? Seeing all those cars stuck like that, it makes me want to organize them. Like, if I could just control the traffic, I'd have them moving in no time.
That's so you, Monica. You'd probably be out there with a whistle and one of those bright orange vests, directing cars. "Not just clean, Monica clean," but like, "Not just traffic, Monica traffic!"
You bet I would! I'd have lanes and schedules. Everything would be on a spreadsheet. Uh! Can’t stand disorder.

A spreadsheet for cars is a bit intense, even for you, Mon. Hey, do you see that red bus? I bet it's full of secret agents on a covert mission disguised as tourists. Or maybe it's a band on tour! Huh, like 'Smelly Bus' instead of 'Smelly Cat'.

You and your imagination. It's probably just full of people wishing they were anywhere but in that traffic. Hey look, there's a big billboard. That ad space must cost a fortune. Imagine if I put up an ad for my catering business up there!

Oooh, that's such a Monica thing to dream about. But if you want to throw money around, I've always wanted to fund a retreat for retired psychic animals. You know, the ones that helped detectives solve crimes. They deserve a spa day too!
Only you, Phoebe. But we should totally go to Bangkok someday, minus the traffic. I hear the food is incredible, and you know me, I'd kill for a chance to try authentic Thai cuisine.
Yes! And I want to go visit the temples, soak up the culture. Ooo, and the shopping. Maybe I'd find some new instruments for my music. Like a... Thai... triangle?
And I'll plan the trip, make sure we stick to the schedule. I'm always the hostess!
And I'll make sure we go with the flow, maybe speak a little Phoebe French to the locals.
Phoebe, they speak Thai in Bangkok.
I know. But everyone speaks Phoebe French. Au revoir, Bangkok traffic!
Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this picture. There's a cat drinking water straight from the bowl in the sink!
That's adorable! It probably thinks it's people. Or maybe it's a reincarnated person who was a dish washer in a past life.
Could you imagine walking into your kitchen and seeing this? I mean, I know I freaked out over that whole 'cat on my massage table' incident, but this is just too cute.
Yeah, it's a little sneakety-sneak. I bet this kitty's name is Mr. Whiskers or something mystical like Aquarius Moonbeam.
Aquarius Moonbeam? Phoebe, where do you come up with these names?
You know, I just connect with the universe and...poof! It tells me. So, what would you name it?
I'm no good with names. Remember when I wanted to name Emma, Ella? It's not exactly creative.
Ella's a lovely name though. But this kitty, with its little head inside the bowl... it's like it's saying, "This is my pool, and I shall drink from it henceforth."
"Henceforth"? Phoebe, you've been hanging around Ross too much.
Maybe... Oh, or maybe the cat's getting ready for a fancy event, a 'Purr-litzer' Prize party, and it's just freshening up!
If that cat is going to a 'Purr-litzer' Prize party, it better dress up. Although, it would still be better dressed than Gunther. Have you seen his ties?
Honey, those ties are a cry for help. I should offer to cleanse his aura. Or his wardrobe.
Speaking of wardrobes, that fluffy fur is kind of stylish. Don't you think it would make a statement on the runway?
For sure. It can start a trend. ‘Fluffier is better!’ The fashion industry is not ready for this level of fluff.
Sometimes I really can't tell if you're serious or not, Pheebs.
I'm as serious as a cat in a sink, Rach.
Whoa, check out this fridge! It's huge enough to hold all my sandwiches. Hey, Pheebs, what do you think, should I get it?
It's nice, Joey... but isn't it kind of, you know, excessive? It's like "Hello, I'm the fridge that ate Manhattan."
But imagine, Pheebs, I could have a shelf for pizza, one for subs, and one just for meat! And look at that guy, he seems pretty happy with it, huh?
True, he does look happy. But maybe he's smiling because he just freed a bunch of chickens and they're living inside that fridge now. You know, because it's basically a studio apartment for poultry.
Haha, Pheebs, only you could turn a fridge into a chicken sanctuary. C'mon, think of the parties I could throw with this baby. I could be the king of cold cuts!
Okay, you could be the king, but remember, "with great power comes great responsibility." You have to use it for the good of mankind, like... by throwing a party for charity! Or making a giant salad.
Salad in my fridge? Oh no no, Pheebs. Joey doesn't share food... with vegetables. You know that!
Alright, alright, but promise me you'll at least consider keeping some tofu in there for your veggie friends? I mean, it's so big, you could even fit a cow in there. Not that you should!
How about this, I'll keep a tiny corner for your tofu... and my non-dairy creamer. Because deep down, Joey's a considerate guy. But the rest of it, that's meat territory.
Deal! As long as the tofu's not touching the meat. They like their personal space. It's a tofu thing.
Heh, it's a date... um, I mean like a friend date! We'll go shopping for the fridge, and you can pick out the best tofu.
Great! And Joey, if that fridge starts talking to you, don't forget, my therapist is just a phone call away.
Haha, will do, Pheebs. Now let's go find that salesman. Joey's got some negotiating to do - maybe I can throw in a headshot for a discount. How you doin', Mr. Salesman?
Hey, Phoebe, check this out! Have you ever seen cows this curious about a camera?
Oh wow, they're totally checking us out. It's like they're saying, "Hey, humans, what's up with the clicky box thing?"
It's actually really interesting from an evolutionary standpoint. You see, this type of behavior could suggest that they have a cognition level—
Or maybe they're just big ol' moo-tanical paparazzi fans! You know, "Moo, smile for the camera, click click, moo!"
"Moo-tanical"? Phoebe, that's not even a word. But speaking of botany, you know, cows play a crucial part in agricultural ecosystems. Through grazing, they—

Yes, yes, they eat the grass and give back to the earth. It's the Circle of Life, Simba stuff. But also, can we talk about how that one cow there has the gentlest eyes? She kind of reminds me of my old friend Gladys. She wasn't a cow, but she had very bovine energy. Peaceful, you know?
Bovine energy, huh? I guess that makes sense in Pheebs-logic. But those gentle eyes are actually a result of domestication. See, docile animals were more likely to be bred, and—

Ross, sometimes you don't have to dig so deep, you know? Just enjoy their bovine beauty! Like, maybe they want to be friends with us. I bet they're all named after spices or something cute... Like the one on the left is totally a "Cinnamon."
Phoebe, I think you're anthropomorphizing a bit too much. Cows don't really have names like—
Oh sure they do, Ross. And if you listen close enough, they might just tell you. Like that one there is whispering, "Hi, I'm Nutmeg." See, doesn't that just feel right?
"Feel right"? In science, we don't base things on—
In Phoebe-land, we base everything on feelings. Speaking of which, I feel like these cows want us to sing to them. Fancy a verse of "Smelly Cat" but maybe we can adapt it to "Smelly Cow"?
Only you could turn a herd of cattle into a sing-along, Phoebe. But I think I'll pass on the singing. I'm still getting over the last performance.
Your loss! They won't judge you, Ross. Cows are the best audience, always receptive and never a "boo." Plus, I'm sure they'd appreciate your "moo-sical" talent.
"Moo-sical" talent? That's really... quite something, Phoebe. But alright, I'll bite. How does "Smelly Cow" go?
It's easy! Just follow my lead. 🎶"Smelly Cow, Smelly Cow, it's not your fault... They blame you for the methane, but it's just a result of your ruminant fault!"🎶
That's...creatively informative! You know, Phoebe, in all the weirdness, there's a kind of genius to you.
And there's a kind of professor in you waiting to break free and embrace the bovine love. Come on, Dr. Moo-ss, give it a try!
You're relentless. Okay, here goes... 🎶"Smelly Cow, what are they feeding you? Is it grass or is it grain? Either way, you'll chew...and chew!"🎶
Yes, Ross! See, this is fun. And look, the cows are coming closer. They totally love it! We're like the cow whisperers.
Or they're just curious to see who's making all the noise. But I have to admit, this is pretty enjoyable. Thanks for the, uh, unique perspective, Phoebe.
Anytime, Ross. Nature's got it all if you're open to listening. Now, shall we take a selfie with our new cow friends? Say "moo" on three!
Look at that picture, Phoebe! That's such a vintage phone! Reminds me of the one we had growing up. I can't believe it's just sitting there, on a shelf. It's like, perfect decor placement.
Yeah, it's got that retro vibe going on. And the cat... it's like it's straight out of a cozy mystery book. Maybe it's on a secret mission to save the world. Or at least the living room.
That's a pretty good detective story, but honestly, I can't get over how the cable is coiled so neatly! It’s so... satisfying.
I know you'd appreciate the tidy cable. By the way, is that your dream kitchen in the background? It looks super clean and organized.
I'd have to get a closer look to be sure, but from what I can tell, yes! Look at the way those magnets are all aligned on the fridge. Not just clean, Monica clean.
You know though, I bet that cat is the actual ruler of the kitchen. It has that 'noble guardian of the food' stance.
Honestly, if I had a cat, I'd train it to be that neat. It would need to have patterns of behavior. Patterns, Phoebe. Like sit, patrol, nap in a perfectly symmetric manner on the couch.
No, Monica. Cats can't be controlled like that, they're mysterious creatures. They walk between worlds… and knock things off tables.
Trust me, if anyone could organize a cat, I could. I mean, it's all about setting the ground rules.
Speaking of other worlds... What if this photo is like a portal into another dimension where everything is the opposite? That cat is actually a person and the humans are the pets?
Phoebe, that's... quite the imagination you have there! But, if that were true, I'm sure opposite Monica would still find a way to clean up the place, even if she were a cat!
Absolutely! And I'd be there singing 'Smelly Cat' to all the human pets while you clean up their hairballs.
Okay, Phoebe, you've got to see this! What do you think is happening here with this tiger in the back of a pickup truck?
Wow. Is that like one of those new carpool initiatives? Because I think that's taking it a little too far, even for me.
Seriously, Pheebs? It's a tiger! That can't be safe... or legal. Imagine if we saw something like that in New York.
Maybe the tiger's just hitching a ride. You know, like how cats always land on their feet? Maybe tigers always land in the back of trucks!
I can't tell if you're kidding. I'm weirdly obsessed with the logistics here. Do you think they used a ramp? Or maybe a really big cat carrier?
Mon, you would think about the logistics. I'm more worried about what happens if he sees a mouse. Imagine a tiger loose on the freeway chasing a little mouse!
Yikes. Now that's a traffic jam I don't want to be a part of. I guess it’s not just clean, Monica clean, but also safety regulations, Monica safe.
Absolutely. And what if he gets hungry? I hope they don't feed him smelly cats, because, you know, that's just wrong on so many levels.
Phoebe! You know that's just a song, right? Tigers don't eat smelly cats. And honestly, under no circumstances should a tiger be carted around like a piece of furniture.
Of course, I know it's a song. My point is animal welfare should be a priority. Tigers should roam free, or, you know... be in those big, fancy animal resorts they call sanctuaries.
I agree. This guy needs a rescue or something. How about we find out where this is and call a sanctuary?
Yes! Let’s do that. Also, we could totally write a song about this. "Tiger in the Truck," and it'll be a hit in the animal rescue community!
You write the song, I'll make the call. Let's save a tiger today! How's that for achieving something before breakfast?
It’s heroic, Monica. You're not just a shoe; you're a tiger-saving boot today!
Oh my god, Phoebe, look at this bathroom. It's just so clean and organized. Like, it's almost Monica clean!
Wow, yeah. It's so... shiny. It's like it's smiling at me. If bathrooms could smile. Which, they can't. But, you know, in a parallel universe maybe…
I can just imagine having a bath in that tub. With the lights dimmed, a few candles... It would be the perfect end to a stressful day.
Totally. And those candles should be made with essential oils and the tears of a unicorn or something. It would be the most magical bath ever!
Phoebe, obviously, unicorns don't cry. If they even existed, which they don't. But I agree on the essential oils, they would add a nice touch. I'd organize them by scent intensity.
Well, I believe unicorns exist in some form. Besides, you can't prove that they don't. Did you notice the mirror? How it's just perfectly clear? Not a single smudge.
I know, right? It's probably one of those fancy anti-fog mirrors. No water marks even after a hot shower. That's the dream!
Speaking of dreams, think how amazing my spirit songs would sound with the acoustics in there. The echo would be like, my backup singers. "Smelly Cat" would be... a little less smelly.
Your songs don't need an echo, Phoebe. They're already as unique as you are. By the way, did you spot the Aloe plant by the sink? It’s such a nice green touch.
The plant’s my favorite part! It adds life and love and it's probably sending us good energy right now. I can feel it through the picture.
A picture sending good energy, huh? Oh, Phoebe, never change. You know what, let’s go to a spa this weekend. We can get massages, sing in their echo-y bathrooms, and feel that good energy in person.
That sounds like the most relaxing idea you've ever had. You love me, don't you?
Of course, I do. Now let's get out of here, and I'll start planning the perfect spa day. It's gonna be great!
Yay! This is brand new information... to my back muscles. They can’t wait!
Phoebe, check this out. It's not something you see every day on the streets of New York, huh?
Oh wow, is that like, a high-tech mystery machine?

Sort of. It looks like a mobile ladder unit, probably for window cleaning or maybe some light industrial work. But those stacked ladders are giving me serious anxiety; the center of gravity on that truck must be all over the place!
Or it could be a vehicle for a team of super-secret squirrel spies, doing acrobatics and stuff. That would explain the ladders!
Spy squirrels, Pheebs? Really?
You never know, Ross. Maybe they're on a mission to prevent a nut shortage crisis. The world is full of possibilities!
I'm just picturing now, a bunch of squirrels in little helmets climbing up those ladders.
In adorable tiny spy gear! Oh, look at the license plate. Maybe that's a secret code or something?
Actually, it's most likely just a regular plate. But, you can almost imagine that truck is part of a chase scene in a movie. Ooh, like "Die Hard," only with ladders.
And Bruce Willis having to balance on the top during the big finale? I'd pay to see that!
I can't believe we're making an action movie out of a cleaning truck. Only with you, Phoebe, only with you.
Thank you. I accept that compliment with grace and imaginary popcorn.
Check out this picture. I can't believe how intricate that clock is! I wonder if it keeps perfect time—I mean, it has to, right? Anything else would just be... wrong.

Wow, yeah. It's like the universe telling time. But Monica, you know sometimes the essence of a thing is more important than the thing itself. Like, what if it's a couple of minutes off, but it inspires someone to write a timeless poem?
Timeless poem? Phoebe, it's a clock. Its one job is to be accurate! And look at the statues around it—everything is so symmetrical and balanced. That's craftsmanship!

Symmetry is in the eye of the beholder—or wait, is that beauty? Anyway, it's all about balance in life, right? I bet you those statues come to life when the clock strikes midnight. Just like in my song, "Dancing Statues in the Moonlight."

Dancing statues, Phoebe? Come on, you don't really believe that...although that would be kinda cool. Can you imagine cleaning a place like that? It would take forever to dust, but oh, I would so volunteer to do it!

Of course you would. Though, I think the statues would prefer a gentle touch. And who knows, maybe they do a little cleaning themselves if they're up and about at night. Teamwork makes the dream work!

Ha! They would be the perfect little helpers, wouldn't they? I just noticed the words "Egalité" and "Fraternité" on the clock—those are such strong, powerful ideals. It's pretty amazing that, besides the time, the clock is also displaying values.
Totally! It's like saying, "Hey, take a moment and think about equality and brotherhood." Time isn't just about the seconds ticking by; it's about making those seconds mean something.

Phoebs, sometimes you say the strangest things, but that... that was actually quite profound. You know, between the clock's precision and your philosophical musings, maybe there's some sort of middle ground where we both make sense.
Yes, it's like your meticulousness meets my free spirit, and we create the perfect 'Monica and Phoebe' time. Imagine that world—oh, it would be so magical and organized!
And it would be absolutely spotless—not just clean, Monica clean! But I’ll let the magic part slide for you, Phoebe. Now, what time is it on that clock? Let's see if it's accurate!
Aha, you're asking the wrong person, Mon. I don't believe in time. I'm on Phoebe time—it flows, it dances, and occasionally, it even sings!
Wow, look at this, Phoebe. What do you think happened to that bus and boat?
Oh! Maybe they're on a date and their love is so strong, not even land and sea can keep them apart!

Ha! A geologist might say they were swept here by some kind of flood or mudslide event, but yours is definitely more romantic. I'm just baffled by the positioning. This must've been quite the natural disaster.
Or the universe's way of creating a new aquatic species. I bet there's a mermaid in that boat just waiting for the right time to introduce herself to the world.
A mermaid? Phoebe, you know those don't actually exist, right? I mean, scientifically speaking, it's—
Ross, always with science. Just open your mind like this much. Imagine a world where mermaids teach us to breathe underwater!
Okay, I'll give you that. Breathing underwater would be pretty cool. But back to the photo, the arrangement here is extraordinary. The bus almost looks like it crashed into the boat.

Ross, don't be so dark! Maybe it's an art installation! You know, symbolizing the journey of life—how we're all on a giant bus-boat, cruising through the universe, trying not to crash into each other.
An art installation, huh? Hmm, I can see that. A metaphorical junction between two paths of travel: water and land. That actually would be a profound statement about the human condition.
Exactly! And maybe at night, they light it all up and it becomes a beacon of hope for all the lost souls looking for direction.
Well, when you put it like that, it doesn't sound half bad. Phoebe, you've got quite the imagination. Shall we try to find out the real story behind this?
Yes! Let's! But no matter what we find out, I'm still believing there's a mermaid captain sailing that bus-boat across the sky at night.
To sail the sky in a bus-boat... Now that would be something to see. Even I'd like to sign up for that cruise!
Wow, look at all those fresh vegetables, Phoebe. Isn't it just... it's like a paleontologist uncovering a new species when you find a really good bunch of leafy greens.

Totally, it's like Mother Nature's treasure trove. And, you know, if those vegetables could talk, I bet they'd have the most amazing stories, like about the rain and the earth and little worms as friends.
Talking vegetables, huh? I mean, that could revolutionize science if we found ones that could actually communicate.
Uh-huh, yeah, and then maybe people would finally listen to me about the plant feelings. You know, Ross, they have souls. I can feel it. They're all like, "Thank you, Phoebe, for not eating us."

Phoebe, you know I respect your beliefs. I just think we need, you know, a tad more empirical evidence on... plant sentience. But I admit, this all looks super healthy—must be good for the body and the soul, right?
Absolutely, Ross. It's like eating sunshine. And speaking of sunshine, when are you gonna let it into your heart and admit that evolution could be, like, just one option?

Evolution is not an 'option,' Phoebe. It's a well-documented, thoroughly researched fact. But let's not digress. How about we just enjoy the beauty of these garden gifts without debating my... our entire scientific belief system?
Okay, sure, we can do that. Oh look, tiny human spotted amongst the veggies! It's like a cute little garden gnome but real and probably doesn't know how to make shoes.

That's classic Phoebe. That's just a kid, probably learning about where food comes from. Teaching moments like this, they're so important. It's like what I do with Ben and dinosaurs, except you know, more current.
Yeah, and less extinct-y. Hey, maybe we could teach the kid to sing "Smelly Cat" but like, "Healthy Veg," you know, giving peas a chance!
Haha, "giving peas a chance," that's clever. You know, your songs really could help kids learn about healthy eating. It's genius, Phoebe.
Aw, Ross! That... that is so sweet. You finally get me.
Of course, I get you. After all these years, how could I not? Now, let's grab some of this kale before all the good leaves are gone.
On it! And then we can go on a hunt for the mystical wild berries of wisdom! Or you know, just blueberries from the market, whatever we find first.
Look at this cow by the water, Phoebe. It looks so peaceful, doesn't it remind you a bit of the countryside?
Yeah, it's like this cow is the animal embodiment of tranquility. And it's reflecting on water, reflecting on life... Oh hey, that's deep, like a soulful, cow haiku!
I was thinking, it looks kind of stylish too, don't you think? Like, if I were a cow, I'd definitely be that one. Graceful by the waterside...
Totally, if you were a cow, you'd be the most fashionable cow in the pasture, with the best spots. It would graze on organic grass and have its own line of designer milk.
Designer milk, I love that! But remember my trifle? Probably the milk from this cow would make it actually taste good. No meat, though. All vegetarian, for your sake.
Oh my goddess, Rach, your trifle. If cows made jam, then totally! And sure, vegetarian because we don't want to upset its aura. Cows have auras too, you know.
Do they have big auras or small, 'cause I imagine a cow aura would be huge.
Enormous! And they're a beautiful shade of green. See, people think green auras are just for plants, but they're for super chill cows too.
Well, I might not know about cow auras, but one thing's for sure, it makes for one picturesque scene. Maybe I should've been a photographer instead of working in fashion.
Rachel Green, world-renowned cow photographer! I can see it now. Hey, imagine if it could model for Moo-chi, or Cattle Klein!
Phoebe, only you would come up with something like that. Cattle Klein... that's actually kinda catchy.
Hey Phoebs, check it out! Doesn't this mouse look like something that would belong in a spaceship?
Oh my God, yeah! It looks so clean and shiny. Like it's been kissed by moonbeams or something.
Moonbeams, huh? If that's what they're using for tech stuff now, I gotta get myself to the moon!
Oh Joey, you can't just go to the moon for a computer mouse. Besides, your acting gigs aren't exactly NASA material yet.
Heh, yeah. I guess I'll stick to sandwiches for now. Still, it'd be something, huh? Joey Tribbiani, the first actor-astronaut!
Totally. You could pioneer the first space drama. And eat moon sandwiches—hey, wait, do you think they have pizza on the moon?
If they don't, that's gonna be the first thing I bring up there! "One small step for man, one giant pizza for Joey!"
Just promise me when you're famous for moon-acting, you won't forget about us little Earth people.
Never! You kidding? You guys are my family. Plus, who else would I share my zero-gravity meat sweats with?
Right, share. Because "Joey doesn't share food!"—even if it's floating around in space.
Exactly! Some things never change, Phoebs. Not even in space.
