Look at these cows, Phoebs. They're just grazing without any care in the world. I wonder if they realize how good they have it just eating grass all day. Do you think they ever get tired of the same menu?
You know, Rach, I actually think they're living their best life. Grass to a cow is like... well, it's like a never-ending supply of your favorite frozen yogurt. They just eat, sleep, and be merry!
Frozen yogurt... Oh, that does sound good right now. But I mean, come on, look at their expressions. They have to be bored; they literally have the same thing every single day!

Well, it's kind of like how I feel about my "Smelly Cat" song. I could play it every day, and it never gets old. Maybe for these cows, every blade of grass is like a different note in their favorite symphony.
Phoebe, only you would compare eating grass to playing "Smelly Cat." But you do have a point – they say happiness is about enjoying the simple things in life.
Exactly! And look at their coats, shiny and black. I bet in cow world, that one out front is like the supermodel of the pasture.
True, that is one glossy coat. It's like the bovine equivalent of a shiny hair commercial. Maybe she's born with it, or maybe it's just moo-beline.
Moo-beline, that's gold, Rachel! Hey, maybe she knows your thing for fashion, and she’s like, "Oh look, Rachel Green is watching, I better work it."
Haha, Phoebe, that would be the day! I become a style icon for the cow community. But honestly, now I kind of want to give her a little accessory, like a cute bell or something.
Or a nice little eco-friendly hat. She could start a new trend: "Pasture Chic." We could totally start a fashion line, Rachel!
"Pasture Chic" by Green and Buffay... Oh, I love it! And hey, we'd have a built-in customer base right here. Though I'm not quite sure how we'd work out the sizes...
We'll just go with small, medium, large, and cow! Easy peasy. Oh, and we need a kids' line for the calves! "Moo-squirts by Phoebe and Rachel!"
“Moo-squirts!” Oh my God, Phoebe, that's adorable. We could even make little hoof mittens for the winter... But let's not forget the male models. We need something for the bulls, too.
Yes, we'll call it "Bull Bravado" – it's daring, it's bold, it's... grass-stained chic!
This is too funny, Phoebe! I'm going to remember this chat every time I see a cow now. Thank you for the laughs, as always.
Anytime, Rach. Remember, when life gets tough, sometimes you just gotta put on your imaginary eco-friendly hat and keep grazing!
Whoa, look at that dude riding the waves. That's like... super intense, huh?
Oh wow, yeah. He's like the Poseidon of the surfer world. King of the ocean waves!
You think he ever gets scared, you know, being all surrounded by all that water?
Definitely. But I believe he has a special bond with the water spirits. They guide him so he can dance on the waves. It's all very mystical.
Water spirits, huh? Is that a real thing or a Phoebe thing?
Joey, it's as real as the nose on your face. Plus, water spirits love pizza.
They do? Man, I have got to meet these water spirits. Although, I gotta tell ya, I'm not sharing my pizza with them.
Don’t worry. They're more into the essence of pizza. The soul pizza.
Soul pizza? Is that, like, a new topping? Because it sounds delicious.
It's the most important part. It's what makes a pizza... pizza. Just like how surfing isn’t just about being on the board, it’s about connecting with the wave.
Huh, I never thought of it that way. You know, Phoebs, sometimes you’re really deep. And other times, I have no idea what you’re talking about.
Thank you, Joey. I am a complex enigma wrapped in a riddle. Or, you know, just your average musician slash masseuse who telepathically communicates with oceanic beings.
Yeah, you're definitely one of a kind. Hey, you think I could learn how to surf?
I think you could do anything you set your mind to. Just remember to respect the ocean. Oh, and make sure there's a lifeguard. You're not exactly a 'fish in the water' kind of guy.
Got it. Respect the ocean, and always swim near the hottie with the whistle. Got it.
And, Joey, if you ever catch a big wave, just yell, 'How you doin?', ocean style.
Now that is something I can definitely do.
Oh wow, Phoebe, check this out! That's such a clear shot of an airplane propeller in motion. Isn't it fascinating how a camera can make it look so still?
Yeah, it's like when you do that thing where you snap your fingers and it stops raining for just a second. You know what I mean?
Uh, I'm not sure I do that, Pheebs. But it's amazing how the blades seem to just hover in mid-air.
It's like the propeller is a hummingbird that drank a lot of coffee and is just...vibrating in place.
Coffee would do that to me too. I do love the view from the airplane window, though. Look at that landscape! So tidy and patchwork-like—almost as satisfying as organizing my closet.
For sure. And the clouds look like little sheep herded by a really neat, controlling sheepdog. Maybe one with obsessive tendencies and a very specific idea about cloud formations.
Ha-ha, Phoebe. They do look extra fluffy from up here, don't they?
Totally. And you know, this might be where cloud sheep go to get their wool sheared. By, like, angel barbers or something.
Can you imagine if I tried to comb those clouds? Now that's a cleaning challenge.
Monica, even the sky isn't safe from your dust-busting ambitions!
Guilty as charged. But just think of the mile-high clean club I could start here!
And you'd be the president, of course! Maybe you could use those propellers to whisk away any cloud dirt.
Always the innovator, Phoebe. But then again, those propellers do look they mean business.
Yep, they're no smelly cats, that's for sure.
Whoa, check this out, Pheebs! This guy's skiing like there's a pizza at the bottom of the hill.
Joey. You think everything is about food. But I bet he's just communing with the snowy spirits of the mountain.
Snowy spirits? You think there's like, a Yeti down there?
Maybe. If the Yeti is cool, it would probably let him pass unharmed. But I sense this person is fearless, embracing the snowy abyss with the heart of a lion.
Or the stomach of a Joey, 'cause man, skiing’s a lot of work! You know what I'd need after a day on the slopes—meatball sub. Skiing, meatball sub, that’s the dream.
Your dream maybe. I'm more interested in the tree in the background. It's standing there all alone, like the noble protector of the mountain.
Protector, like a superhero? Oh, I could be a superhero who skis down mountains to save... sandwiches from evil deli owners!

That's oddly specific, Joey. And very you. But back to the mysterious lone skier, maybe he's on a quest. Imagine, he’s skiing not for sport, but to find something lost long ago in these frozen depths.
Yeah, like his car keys! Ha, imagine trying to find those in all this white stuff.
Or, the keys to a forgotten realm where summer and winter collide, creating a never-ending cascade of snowflakes and sunshine. That’s the stuff legends are made of.
Pheebs, your imagination is wild. But you've gotta admit, if you’re gonna have an eternal winter-summer land, you’d need to have a food court. You know, for ski snacks. Balance is important!
Balance, yes. Like the universe must balance the sun's flaming chariot with the moon’s silver canoe.
A silver canoe? That'd look pretty cool on my shelf, right next to my Huggsy, my bedtime penguin pal. But hey, we should totally hit the slopes together sometime!
Sure, Joey, you can ski and I'll summon the winter fairies to guide us down safely!
Hey, Phoebes, check this out. Isn't this bus looking a little, I don't know, futuristic to you?
Wow, yeah. It's, like, cleaner for Mother Earth, right? It says "electric." Good for you, little bus.
Electric, huh? Imagine if all the pizzas in New York were delivered in these electric buses. Pizzas saving the planet!
And think of all the positive energy those pizzas would have. They would be like "I'm not just a delicious pizza, I'm a delicious pizza with a purpose."
Ha! Pizza with a purpose. I like that, Phoebe. Do you think it's fast though? 'Cause I don't want my pepperoni going cold.
Well, it's not about the speed, Joey. It's about the journey—being at one with the universe and the traffic.
Speaking of traffic, there's none. We could've taken a ride on the bus instead of walking in the cold. Brrr!
No, Joey. This is good for us. It's like the universe is giving us a big, chilly hug, reminding us we're alive. Plus, walking keeps your muscles big and strong, like... those kangaroos you like.
Kangaroos? You mean Rocky and Bullwinkle?
Sure. Do kangaroos make you think of sandwiches?

You know me too well, Pheebs. Everything makes me think of sandwiches. But hey, if we catch the electric bus, maybe we can sing "The Wheels on the Bus" while we ride. You do the tune, and I'll make up some sandwich-inspired lyrics!
That seems like a beautiful merging of our creative spirits, Joey. Okay, but only if we can add a verse about smelly cat finding a new life on the electric bus.
Deal!  But, uh, Phoebe, this bus doesn't actually smell like cats, right? 'Cause I'm allergic to cats, you know.
No worries, Joey. It's just a song. The bus smells like... the future. And possibly a hint of lavender.
The future, huh? I can get on board with that. As long as there's room for my sandwich.
Check this out, Phoebe. Have you ever seen a line of buses like this before? It's like a red brigade on a mission.
Oh wow, yeah. They're like majestic red elephants, marching to the beat of the city jungle.
Majestic red elephants? I was thinking it's more like a well-organized public transportation display. Efficient and reliable.

Ross, when you look at the world, you see a fossil. When I look, I see a wise old tree telling its stories. These buses, they're not just transporting people; they're holding individual universes of stories and adventures!
I mean, sure, if you want to get all poetic about it. But from a logistical standpoint, imagine the coordination it takes. The schedules, the routes—it's very impressive.
Ross, sometimes you just have to feel the city's heartbeat, not measure its blood pressure, you know?
That's... an interesting analogy.  Though, if I could measure the city's blood pressure, that'd be a fascinating study into urban stress.
And while you do that, I'll be here serenading the stressed-out souls with my guitar. "Oh, city buses, red and long, share with me your urban throng..."
I have to say, the idea of you holding a concert for buses is oddly charming. Just please promise me you’ll stay on the sidewalk, safety first.
Ross, I'm not an alien, I know how streets work. Although... performing for intergalactic spaceships would be an unforgettable gig.
Intergalactic...  Right. Well, if there's ever a need for a paleontologist on your space tour, count me in.
Absolutely! You can explain the formation of asteroids while I sing about cosmic love. We'll be a hit.
"Cosmic love," huh? I guess our duo would be out of this world.  Shall we go get some coffee and brainstorm our space setlist?
Yes, let's do that. And Ross, just so you know, in our act, we will take turns sharing fun facts. I have loads of them about the moon.
Deal. And Phoebe, "They don't know that we know they know we know" that we're going to be the greatest space act ever.
You got it, paleontologist guy!
Oh my god, Phoebe, look at this! That's a Philly cheesesteak, right? Oh, and the fries… can you smell that through the picture? It's perfection just begging to be organized on a plate.
Yeah, it does look yummy, but, oh! Poor cows. Though those fries are calling to me like little golden siren sticks.
You think they're crispy enough? If not, I could totally show them how to do it right. A little more time in the fryer, and you'd get that perfect crunch.
I believe you, but all I’d need is just a tiny, tiny sprinkle of sea salt and some of that mystical ketchup made from, you know, enchanted tomatoes.

Ha! You and your 'enchanted tomatoes.' Seriously though, if I could jump into this image, I’d rearrange that sandwich so you could see every layer of those delicious ingredients. You gotta respect the layers, Pheebs!
True, I mean, each layer is like an individual with their own story. Imagine, each slice of bell pepper, an outcast finding their home amongst the cheese.
You just get it. It's like the peppers, onions, and steak all have to work together - it's teamwork! Maybe I should make this for the next group dinner.
You should! But make sure there's a vegetarian option. Oh! Maybe a "Philly Cheesefake?" With, like, mushrooms instead of steak and vegan cheese! What do you say, Mon?
Cheesefake? I love it! Sounds like a challenge, and I am always up for a challenge. Alright, it's settled. I'll do a meat version and a Phoebe version!
The cows and I thank you in advance. This meal is going to be legen-dairy… without the dairy!
Would you look at that, Phoebe? That's... that's actually a unicycle. Wait, is this guy delivering mail on it?
He's not just delivering mail, Ross. He's delivering joy and balance into the universe.
I admit it's kinda cool, but from a practical standpoint, wouldn't a bike be more efficient?

Ross, when have I ever been about efficiency? This is poetic motion! Besides, I bet he's part of a secret society of unicycle mail carriers. They're probably called... the Wheely Envelope Brigade or something.
A secret society of... Phoebe, where do you come up with these things?
Where do you not come up with these things, Ross? It’s imagination! Plus, I think Stephanie Schiffer is an undercover member.
You know what, Phoebe? I'm not even going to ask who Stephanie is. I'm just going to admire this fearless mailman who's somehow managed to defy both convention and gravity.
Right? He's like a superhero! Captain Balance, emissary of... envelopes!
Okay, okay, I'll buy it. Captain Balance it is. Hey, do you think he'd let us try the unicycle?
Oh my god, yes! And once we master it, we can join the brigade! Watch out, Captain Balance, here come... General Geller and Major Phalange!
Major Phalange. I should have seen that one coming. But first, we should probably start with helmets. I'm not particularly known for my... balance.
A wise decision, General. The brigade values safety above all else. But for the record, I was born to ride a unicycle, Ross. Born to ride!
Hey, Pheebs, check out this image. That's one fancy looking clock tower, huh?
Wow, yeah. It has a very old-world charm, like it holds centuries of mysteries.
Yeah. And it makes me wonder what time it is there. Which is weird, 'cause I have a watch.
Maybe the clock tower is like, the guardian of time. It doesn't just tell time, it keeps it.
Whoa. That's deep. But, uh, what do you think it’s doing with all that time?
It's probably saving it up... for a time emergency. You know, like how squirrels save nuts for winter.
A time emergency? That's amazing! If I had extra time, I'd take a nap... or maybe two.
Classic Joey. But imagine, if we could climb up to the top and shout into the wind, announcing lunchtime to the world.
Oh man, now that would be the best use of time! Speaking of lunchtime, you think there's a pizza place around that clock tower?
Probably, they'd be missing a huge opportunity if there wasn't. Time and pizza, they go hand in hand.
Exactly! 'Cause y'know, Joey doesn’t share food... but I will always share a moment in time with you, Pheebs.
Aww, Joey, that's actually really sweet. And I'd share a vegetarian pizza with you. But not the time - that's the clock tower's job.
